description:
Poland
October 8th 2020
"Hospital security is our priority in the fight against the coronavirus. We observe, analyze and react on an ongoing basis.

Therefore, we are increasing the number of beds for COVID-19 patients. A coordination hospital will be established in each voivodeship, with additional intensive care stations for patients infected with coronavirus.

The Coordination Hospital will act as the main hospital in a given voivodeship. Importantly, it will be focused on caring for a patient with COVID-19. The directors of these institutions will be included in the voivodeship crisis management teams, which will coordinate:

    patient flow between hospitals in consultation with doctors from other hospitals, primary care physicians and outpatient specialist care physicians,
    movement of "swab" and transport ambulances,

description:
Poland
February 28th 2020
"
What is Coronavirus?

The new SARS-Cov-2 coronavirus causes a disease called COVID-19. The disease is most often manifested by fever, cough, shortness of breath, muscle aches and fatigue.
How common are symptoms?

The severe course of the disease is observed in about 15-20% of people. Deaths occur in 2-3% of sick people. Probably these data are overestimated, because in many people with a mild course of the infection, laboratory confirmation has not been made.
Who is most at risk?

The most vulnerable to severe disease and death are elderly, immunocompromised people accompanied by other diseases, especially chronic ones.
How to protect yourself against the coronavirus?

The virus is spread by airborne droplets. There is currently no vaccine against the new coronavirus. However, other methods of preventing infection, as outlined below, can be used. These methods are also used in the prevention of other diseases transmitted by airborne droplets, such as seasonal flu (where the peak incidence is between January and March each year).
Where have coronavirus infections been reported so far?

The highest number of confirmed cases of infection with the new coronavirus was registered in China (99%), mainly in Hubei province. The remaining people "dragged" the virus to other countries in Asia, Europe, Oceania and North America and infected other people (eg in Germany, France, Great Britain)."
